intro: Cladocarpa semitonsa, commonly known as the slender sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and narrow, woody stems. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in sandy or coastal areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
